citation.article-title: Reclassification of Lactobacillus amylophilus LMG 11400 and NRRL B-4435 as Lactobacillus amylotrophicus sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus amylotrophicus sp. nov.

Lactobacillus amylotrophicus (a.my.lo.tro′phi.cus. Gr. n. amulon starch; N.L. adj. trophicus from Gr. adj. trophikos nursing, tending; N.L. masc. adj. amylotrophicus growing on starch, pertaining to the ability to ferment starch).
Cells are rod-shaped, occurring singly or in pairs and chains, 1.2–2.0 μm long and 0.9 μm wide, Gram-positive, catalase-negative, oxidase-negative, non-spore-forming and non-motile.
After 24 h, colonies are white, smooth, circular and approximately 1 mm in diameter.
Growth occurs at 15 °C but not at 45 °C.
Facultatively anaerobic and produces l(+)-lactic acid homofermentatively from glucose and starch.
Acid is produced in the API 50 CH kits in tests with d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, aesculin, d-cellobiose, d-maltose, starch, glycogen and gentiobiose.

No acid is produced from glycerol, erythritol, d- or l-arabinose, d-ribose, d- or l- xylose, d-adonitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, arbutin, d-lactose, d-melibiose, sucrose, d-trehalose, inulin, d-melezitose, d-raffinose, xylitol, d-turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d- or l-fucose, d- or l-arabitol, gluconate or 2- or 5-ketogluconate.
Production of acid from amygdalin is strain-dependent.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 43.5 mol%.
The type strain is LMG 11400T (=NRRL B-4436T=DSM 20534T), which was isolated from swine waste-corn fermentation.
